original_definition: 'nuclear-weapon Member States' means Belgium, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Greece, Spain, Ireland, Italy, Cyprus, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Hungary, Malta, the Netherlands, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Slovenia, Slovakia, Finland and Sweden;
generated_definition: 'nuclear-weapon Member States' means members of the european union that possess nuclear weapons and are subject to specific provisions under international law.

Article 2: ‘nuclear-weapon Member States’ means France and the United Kingdom;
Article 34: the provisions of Article 3(2), Article 31 and Article 32(c) shall not apply in the territories of nuclear-weapon Member States.
Specific provisions for nuclear-weapon Member States
